title: Plotting Probability Density/Mass Functions
text: package contains simple wrapper function, pdplot2 visualizes probability density/mass functions provided base R using ggplot2. available probability density/mass functions include following: normal, logistic, binomial, chi-square, poisson, exponential, cauchy, beta, gamma, geometric, Student's t F.

title: Plotting Probability Density/Mass Functions
text: pdplot2 follows convention density distributions R. First need create vector quantiles pass first argument function. , need select correct parameter(s) distribution. Finally, need enter type distribution. example normal distribution,  create normal probability distribution mean 0 sd 1. can pass vector parameter values argument plot multiple density curves.  example binomial distribution,
code: pdplot2(seq(-4, 4, 0.01), mean=0, sd=1, type="normal") pdplot2(seq(-5, 5, 0.01), mean=c(0,0), sd=c(1,2), type="normal") pdplot2(0:25, size=c(20, 30), prob=c(0.4, 0.5), type="binomial")

title: Plotting Probability Density/Mass Functions
text: might want change default linetypes. setting line.selection=TRUE, can pass character vector linetype change .

title: Plotting Probability Density/Mass Functions
text: might also prefer colored plots. show colors instead linetypes, need specify show.color=TRUE.  case linetypes, can change colors. addition show.color=TRUE, need set color.selection=TRUE, pass character vector color.
code: pdplot2(seq(-5, 5, 0.01), mean=c(0,0,0), sd=c(1,1.5,2), type="normal", show.color=TRUE) pdplot2(seq(-5, 5, 0.01), mean=c(0,0,0), sd=c(1,1.5,2), type="normal",          show.color=TRUE, color.selection=TRUE, color=c("black", "blue", "green"))
